H0.text: It melts to form liquid water when a block of ice is heated to 10 °C.

H1.text: It condenses to form liquid water when a block of ice is heated to 10 °C.

H2.text: It freezes to become heavier ice when a block of ice is heated to 10° Celsius.

H3.text: It evaporates to become a vapor (gas) when a block of ice is heated to 10° Celsius.

A4.text: When ice melts, it absorbs as much energy as would be required to heat an equivalent mass of water by 80 °C.
